meanings.sent1: The tired dog respires heavily after running around the park.
meanings.sent2: Every living creature respires to stay alive.
meanings.sent3: The old car respires smoke when it struggles to start.
meanings.sent4: The forest respires with the rhythm of nature's breath.
meanings.sent5: As the diver respires underwater, bubbles escape to the surface.

meanings.definition: To take in oxygen and give off carbon dioxide
meanings.sent1: The tree respires through its leaves, absorbing sunlight and releasing oxygen.
meanings.sent2: Fish respires by extracting oxygen from the water through their gills.
meanings.sent3: The factory chimney respires pollutants into the air, much to the dismay of the townspeople.
meanings.sent4: The city respires with the collective exhale of its inhabitants on a busy day.
meanings.sent5: The athlete respires deeply, filling their lungs with fresh air before the race.

meanings.definition: To undergo the process of respiration
meanings.sent1: Every cell in our body respires to produce energy for us to move and think.
meanings.sent2: Plants respire during the day and night, absorbing nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The compost pile respires as it breaks down organic matter into rich soil.
meanings.sent4: The Earth respires in cycles, balancing the levels of gases in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The baby bird respires for the first time as it hatches from its egg.
